bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to H. Boyd Wylie, January 16, 1953

div1.p: Hench describes the Camp Lazear dedication ceremony and informs Wylie who laid a wreath on his behalf. He requests reimbursement for the cost of the wreath.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to H. Boyd Wylie, January 16, 1953
div1.opener:
January 16, 1953
Dr. H. Boyd Wylie, Dean
School of Medicine
University of Maryland
Baltimore 1, Maryland
My dear Dean Wylie:
div1.p:
Permit me to send you a report of the dedication of Camp Lazear which I
think will interest you. It contains some interesting side lights on
Cuban medical politics.

We had trouble locating Doctor Echeverria. Actually, we didn't locate
him and had a substitute on hand but he showed up at the very last minute
and laid the wreath from the University of Maryland in honor of Doctor
Carroll. Because we did not know he was on hand during the first part of
the ceremony, Major Harold Lampner, Medical Corps of the U. S. Army, in
Cuba with a medical mission, unveiled Doctor Carroll's bronze plaque.
It seemed quite appropriate for a Medical Corps officer attached to the
U. S. Embassy to do this.

I enclose some newspaper clippings about the affair. Should you wish copies
of any of the photographs, I expect to have the films shortly. I am sure
there was one taken of Doctor Echeverria placing your wreath.

The cost of each wreath was $15. They were really very lovely and would
have cost two or three times that much here. They were purchased from
“Milagros Flores,” Lucila Schumann, President, who gave me only one bill
itemizing each wreath and institutional donor. If you need an ozalid
copy I can send it. Otherwise I should be glad to receive a check for
$15 at your convenience.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
Enclosures
P.S.: Neither Doctor Nogueira nor I could find Dr. Echeverria's address in
the Havana telephone directory. I would appreciate it if you would send me
his address as you have it in the Alumni Directory.
